intro: Trillium apetalon f. viridipurpureocarpum, commonly known as the green-purple fruit trillium, is a rare botanical variant of the Trillium genus. It is characterized by its unique foliage, featuring a mix of green and purplish hues on the leaves. The plant produces small, showy flowers with three petals, typically in shades of white or pale pink. Its fruits are distinctive, often displaying a combination of green and purple tones, which gives it its common name. This variant is native to specific regions in North America and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
